component.hero.heading.h2: Open-Source tools to easily build and maintain your event-driven architecture. All powered by the AsyncAPI specification, the
component.hero.paragraph.proudPartOf: Proud to be part of the
pages.index.adoptedBy: Adopted by the world leading brands
pages.index.theseBrands: These brands are already using AsyncAPI in production. Is your company using AsyncAPI and wants to be included in this list?
pages.index.wereACommunity: We're a community of great people who are passionate about AsyncAPI and event-driven architectures.
pages.index.slackWelcome: We welcome everyone to join our Slack workspace. If you have a question on how to use AsyncAPI, want to contribute, or simply want to say hello üëã  you're welcome to join us. We're nice people üôÇ
pages.index.asyncApiHosts: AsyncAPI hosts different meetings every week. They are focused on different topic, sometimes purely technical and sometimes about community building. Pick one and join us!
pages.index.sponsorUsMsg: These great organizations are already supporting AsyncAPI. Want to become a sponsor?
pages.index.supportMsg: The following companies support us by letting us use their products for free. Interested in supporting us too?
pages.index.testimonial1: Microservices underline the need for event-based communication in distributed architectures. AsyncAPI brings the richness of the REST API ecosystem to asynchronous APIs.
pages.index.testimonial2: Event-driven APIs need love too! AsyncAPI brings the many benefits of a machine/human readable specification to these nuanced approaches.
pages.index.testimonial3: Developers need to be able to quickly and consistently create event-driven applications that provide business value and react to customer needs in realtime. I can't count how many times I've heard developers ask for OpenAPI/Swagger style tools for the asynchronous and event driven world, and that is exactly what the AsyncAPI initiative is making a reality.
pages.index.testimonial4: We've been focusing on event-driven APIs since 2014 and thank the AsyncAPI contributors everyday for driving the community towards common standards.
component.features.index.heading: Why AsyncAPI?
component.features.index.subheading: Improving the current state of Event-Driven Architectures (EDA)
component.features.index.description1: Allows you to define the interfaces of asynchronous APIs and is protocol agnostic.
component.features.index.description2: Use our tools to generate documentation at the build level, on a server, and on a client.
component.features.index.description3: Generate documentation, Code (TypeScript, Java, C#, etc), and more out of your AsyncAPI files.
component.features.index.description4: We're a community of great people who are passionate about AsyncAPI and event-driven architectures.
component.features.index.description5: Our Open-Source project is part of Linux Foundation and works under an Open Governance model.
component.features.index.description6: We have many different tools and welcome you to explore our ideas and propose new ideas to AsyncAPI.
